member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SME.GetSMEDeploymentCmdlet
member.summary: Use to get the active deployments from a device.

para.para: The name of the fleet that the device belongs to.
The unique name of the device you want to get the configuration of active deployments from.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SME.GetSMEDeploymentCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Deployments'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SagemakerEdgeManager.Model.GetDeploymentsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SagemakerEdgeManager.Model.GetDeploymentsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SME.GetSMEDeviceRegistrationCmdlet
member.summary: Use to check if a device is registered with SageMaker Edge Manager.

para.para: The name of the fleet that the device belongs to.
The unique name of the device you want to get the registration status from.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SME.GetSMEDeviceRegistrationCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SagemakerEdgeManager.Model.GetDeviceRegistrationResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SagemakerEdgeManager.Model.GetDeviceRegistrationResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SME.GetSMEDeviceRegistrationCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DeviceName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DeviceName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SME.SendSMEHeartbeatCmdlet
member.summary: Use to get the current status of devices registered on SageMaker Edge Manager.

para.para: For internal use. Returns a list of SageMaker Edge Manager agent operating metrics.
Returns the version of the agent.
The timestamp of when the deployment was ended, and the agent got the deployment results.
Returns a list of models deployed on the agent.
The name and unique ID of the deployment.
The timestamp of when the deployment was started on the agent.
The name of the fleet that the device belongs to.
The unique name of the device.
Returns a list of models deployed on the the device.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SME.SendSMEHeartbeatCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SagemakerEdgeManager.Model.SendHeartbeatResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SME.SendSMEHeartbeatCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DeviceName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DeviceName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SME.SendSMEHeartbeatCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
